name: fetch
description: Makes HTTP requests to local network resources (like *.hvs domains, localhost services, or private APIs) that are only accessible from the host machine. Supports all standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS) with customizable headers, body, SSL verification, timeout, and redirect handling. Requests are validated against an allowlist for security. Use this when Claude needs to interact with internal development servers, private APIs, or services with custom DNS entries.

url.description: Target URL to request. Must be in the allowlist and begin with http:// or https://. Examples: http://localhost:3000/api, https://internal.hvs/health

method.description: HTTP method to use. One of: GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS. Defaults to GET.

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers as key-value pairs. Example: {"Authorization": "Bearer token", "Content-Type": "application/json"}

body.description: Request body for POST/PUT/PATCH operations. Sent as-is to the target server. For JSON, stringify the object first.

verify_ssl.description: Whether to verify SSL certificates. Set to false for self-signed certificates in development. Defaults to true.

timeout.description: Request timeout in seconds. Defaults to 30, maximum 300.

follow_redirects.description: Whether to automatically follow HTTP redirects. Defaults to true.
